notes: transitive; takes auxiliary avere; -isc- in present
example_sentence_english: I do not want to terrify anyone.
You (plural) terrify whoever listens to you.

example_sentence_italian: Da piccolo atterrivo i miei fratelli.
example_sentence_english: As a child I used to terrify my brothers.

example_sentence_italian: Da ragazzo atterrivi i più piccoli.
example_sentence_english: As a boy you used to terrify the younger kids.

translation_english: he was terrifying/she was terrifying/you (formal) were terrifying
example_sentence_english: The war was terrifying entire cities.

example_sentence_italian: Atterrivamo il pubblico con effetti speciali.
example_sentence_english: We were terrifying the audience with special effects.

example_sentence_italian: Voi atterrivate gli avversari ogni sera.
example_sentence_english: You (plural) were terrifying the opponents every evening.
The stories were terrifying the children.

translation_english: he has terrified/she has terrified/you (formal) have terrified
notes: used with auxiliary avere; also used as formal Lei
